document_data.name: Vin Valle
document_data.mainbody: '''Vin Valle''' was a painter of some social standing from the city of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.History: As of the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, [[Lady Jannath]] was one of the patrons of Vin's. She purchased at least one painting from the artist â€“ the piece titled ''[[Reflections on Umberlee]]''. Some time later the same year, they were invited to attend the art show titled "Strange Tides: Self-Portraits from the Sword Coast," hosted by Lady Jannath in her [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] estate. ''Reflections on Umberlee'' was one of the paintings on display and the hostess asked her butler, [[Tarhun Mnemonis]], to remind the artist of that upon arrival.
